repnme.cdata!:
Malawi - First, Second and Third Poverty
            Reduction Support Grant Project

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the First, Second and Third
            Poverty Reduction Support Grant Project for Malawi were as
            follows: outcomes were moderately satisfactory; risk to
            development outcome was substantial; Bank performance was
            moderately satisfactory and borrower performance was also
            moderately satisfactory. Some lessons learned includes: the
            importance of Government ownership, taking the time to
            nurture it, through dialogue and analysis of the political
            economy of reforms; the need to have a good understanding of
            political economy of sensitive reforms; merits of working
            within the harmonized framework for the provision of budget
            support; flexibility in the Performance Assessment Framework
            (PAF) to emerging issues should be encouraged; the need for
            a good and robust Monitoring and Evaluation (M&E)
            framework for tracking progress and; ambitions and complex
            reforms should not be avoided completely.

repnme.cdata!:
Malawi - Third Poverty Reduction Support
            Grant Program

abstracts.cdata!:
The Third Poverty Reduction Support
            Grant (PRSG) Program series aims at assisting a reform
            program of the Government of Malawi (GoM) as it implements
            the Malawi Growth and Development Strategy (MGDS) by
            supporting implementation of policy and institutional
            reforms that will lead to the following medium-term
            outcomes: (i) increased agricultural productivity, (ii)
            increased private sector investment, and (iii) sustained
            improvements in fiscal management. The program document is
            divided into six sections, including this introduction.
            Section two discusses the country context which gives an
            overview of Malawi, recent economic developments including
            government's macroeconomic program, macroeconomic
            outlook, and debt sustainability. Section three presents the
            Government's program (MGDS); section four discusses how
            the Bank is supporting the government program, while section
            five describes the third PRSG. Section six describes
            implementation issues, with a focus on risks and mitigating measures.
